hints_html:
A Carmichael number is a composite number n which satisfies

\(\displaystyle b^{n-1} \equiv 1 \mod{n}\)

for all integers with \(\displaystyle \gcd(b,n) = 1\).

Recall Korselt’s criterion which states that a positive composite integer n is a Carmichael number if and only if n is square free and for all prime divisors p of n, it is true that \(\displaystyle (p-1) \mid (n-1)\)

sols_html:
We follow the hints above (especially hint 2) which suggests we should use Korselt’s Criterion. We first factor the number as

\(\displaystyle 2821 = 7 \cdot 403 = 7 \cdot 13 \cdot 31\)

We check that \(\displaystyle (p-1) \mid (n-1)\) for each prime factor. Notice that

\[\begin{aligned} (7-1) = 6 &\mid 2820\\ (13-1) = 12 &\mid 2820 \\ (31-1) = 30 &\mid 2820\end{aligned}\]

We can see these are true by factoring

\(\displaystyle 2820 = 10\cdot 282 = 2\cdot 5 \cdot 2 \cdot 141 = 2^{2} \cdot 5 \cdot 3 \cdot 47 = 2^{2} \cdot 3 \cdot 5 \cdot 47\).

Hence 2821 is a Carmichael number.
